result.title: Snackdown finals live commentary blog
result.content:
Hi All,

Final rankings of the contest.

Overall top 5 in onsite ranking

  1. ancalagon from IIT Bombay consisting of Balajiganapathi and Deepa Panwar
  2. smack_down from Tower Research Captial consisting of Smit Hinsu (Smit) and Siddharth Bora (SiddharthBora)
  3. logicmonks_ from Google consisting of Akashdeep Nain (akashdeep) and Nishant Redkar.
  4. sandy_team from IIT Bombay consisting of Sai Sandeep (harrypotter192).
  5. believe_iiith from IIIT Hyderabad consisting of Pulkit Goel (pulkitg10) and Vivek Hamirwasia (viv001)

Overall top 5 in final online ranking.

  1. aapppppppiii from Tsinghua University having Apia Du and Yinzhan Xu (xyz111)
  2. rake_compress from ITMO consisting of Gennady Korotkevich (tourist) and Borys Minaiev (qwerty787788)
  3. two_captains from Yandex consisting of Mikhail Tikhomirov (Endagorion) and Alexander Mashrabov (map)
  4. sjtu_01 from Shanghai Jiao Tong University consisting of Haobin Ni (TankEngineer) and Yanpei Liu (AngryBacon)
  5. ench_mango from National Taiwan University consisting of Peter Shih (0O0o00OO0Oo0o0Oo) and Kelvin Yang (kelvin).

Congratulations too all of you :) You really deserve it !!!

Overall onsite ranking can be seen here.
Overall finals ranking can be seen here.
Also, mirror ranks can be seen here.

You can check codechef blog to check interviews of many top teams in which they have answered quite interesting and important questions about their preparations, motivation, mistakes etc. I think it will be quite interesting to read that.

Live streaming of the contest can be seen here

6:00 PM Contest has added. I hope that you enjoyed the problems and the contest too :) We will update the ranking in a few hours. Thank you all for joining :) Mirror contest is still running, please feel free to participate in it and enjoy the problems prepared by Chef :)

5:53 PM There is a flurry of submissions going from all the teams :) We will see who gets which problems and who becomes the overall winner and onsite winner of the contest?

5:47PM A team playing solitaire during the contest :P

5:42PM Few pics from the arena

5:00 PM Ranking before freezing time

  1. rake_compress from ITMO
  2. aapppppppiii from Tsinghua University
  3. two_captains from Yandex
  4. sjtu_01 from Shanghai Jiao Tong University
  5. sequoia from Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology
  6. dreamoon_shik from National Taiwan University
  7. kut_team1_sd from Kim Chaek University

Onsite rankings

  1. ancalagon from IIT Bombay
  2. smack_down from Tower Research
  3. logicmonks_ from Google
  4. sandy_team from IIT Bombay
  5. believe_iiith from IIIT Hyderabad
  6. naive_coders from IIT Kanpur
  7. scc_snack15 from BITS Pilani

4:58 PM Team rake_compress consisting of tourist and qwerty787788 is on top of the ranking board just before the freezing time. Will team aapppppppiii from Tsinghua be able to beat them during the freezing time?

4:48 PM Problem setters with their problem names

Sergey Kulik(Cherrytree) -> SHUFFLE2, GUARDS, WMIS
Kevin Charles Atienza(kevinsogo -> RAMSINSP, FUZZYADD, CHEFNKCH
Utkarsh Lath (utkarshl -> ANDMAT, BUGATACK
Istvan Nagy(iscsi) -> TENNIS
Praveen Dhinwa(I_lost_my_handle) -> NICENESS and TIMETRAV

4:41 PM Team rake_compress consisting of tourist and qwerty787788 has too solved the 9th problem and is retaining their 2nd position. There are 15 minutes before the freezing of the round. Let us see whether they will be able to fetch a win like they have done in many other contests or whether this time aapppppppiii will defeat them?

4:36 PM Team faceless_man from IIT Kanpur consisting of Sahil Grover and Atanu Chakraborty sent following postcard message for other teams.

If content is unreadble for you, then here it is "Iterate from 26 to 2 because 1 is me :)"

4:24 PM We will be freezing the contest for last hour. Let us see what suspense unfolds in the last hour. Will rake_compress beat aapppppppiii ? Will there be any changes in top 3 of the onsite ranklist ? How many more problems will be solved by onsite participants etc .

4:22 PM You can see interviews of Team aapppppppiii from Tsinghua University having Apia Du and xyz111 here. Their interview is quite interesting :)

4:18PM 9 problems have been solved by at least one problem. Two more problems are yet to go.

4:14 PM Team aapppppppiii consists of Apia Du and xyz111 are on fire. They are having first position in almost all the contest. They have solved total whopping 9 problems just having 2 more to go in 1 hour and 45 minutes :)

4:09 PM Pic Request by MHungry

Team logicmonks from Google consisting of Akashdeep Nain (akashdeep) and Nishant.

4:08 PM Team rake_compress consisting of tourist and qwerty787788 has too solved the 8th problem. It is getting quite interesting. First and second team positions have only 7 minutes penalty difference. :)

4:05 PM Team aapppppppiii consists of Apia Du and xyz111 submitted their 8th problem just now and gain a solid lead of 1 problem.

4:00 PM Team bandb from IIITH is at currently 9th position. Their team has darkshadows and Nikhil.

3:58 PM Top 5 teams from the India are

  1. ancalagon from IIT Bombay
  2. smack_down from Tower Research
  3. logicmonks_ from Google
  4. sandy_team from IIT Bombay
  5. believe_iiith from IIITH

3:55 PM Top 5 teams have solved 7 problems each. There are total 3 problems which are yet to be solved by anybody. Let's see in the next upcoming hours :)

3:52 PM

Team scc_snack15 from BITS Pilani consisting of Ankul Sareen (akulsareen) and Pranet Verma( pranet)

3:48 PM From onsite contest point of view, there are not much changes in top 5-6 rankings.

3:44 PM Team from my own institute IIT Kanpur, naive_coders having triveni and sshekh currently at position 6th position.

3:39 PM Currently, teams rake_compress and Havka-papstvo are trying to solve problem RAMSINSP. Let's see what happens in few hours !! If rake_compress solves this problem, then they can be at top position.

3:33 PM Egor and pashka's team Havka-papstvo has solved 5 problems and currently at 10th position.

3:23 PM Total 8 problems have been solved. kut_team1_sd from DPRK is the only team to solve BUGATACK problem. Their team consists of kutengine and SuRyong Kim. They have solved total 5 problems. It would be quite nice too see how they solve problems in next few hours.

3:15 PM Now team aapppppppiii and rake_compress are really close with 1st and 2nd positions respectively. One has penalty of 7:25 whereas other has 7:28. Just 3 minutes difference. Both have solved same problems. So, let us see which one is able to find next problem to solve fast :)

3:10 PM There has been a flurry of submissions now in onsite round, top 3 teams have solved 4 problems. Their order has not been changed yet.

3:05 PM
Here is the team from DPS Dwarka, its members (Rajat De and Aditya Popali) has been participants of IOITC camp (training camp for IOI in India).

.

3:00 PM Summary of the contest till now
Almost all onsite teams (24 out of 25 teams) have solved at least one problem.
Total 7 problems have been solved.
Top Indian team ancalagon has solved 4 problems whereas in overall ranking team aapppppppiii has solved whopping total 7 problems which is leading the ranking almost during the entire duration of contest.

2:51 PM Team aapppppppiii consists of Apia Du and xyz111. It will be really interesting to see these guys participating in upcoming ICPC world finals. 2nd, 3rd and 4th ranked teams have famous participants who have achieved a big success in programming contests :)

2:45PM Team rake_compress consisting of tourist and qwerty787788 from ITMO has solved the problem SHUFFLE2 after 2 wrong attempts. They are still at second position.

Team aapppppppiii from Tsinghua is still leading the contest. Next few upcoming hours will be worth watching :)

Teams from NTU are currently at 3rd and 4th positions.

Team ench_mango is at 3rd position. It consists of 0O0o00OO0Oo0o0Oo and kelvin.

Team dreamoon_shik is at 4th position. It consists of dreamoon and shik as their name suggests.

2:40 PM Team sandy_team consisting of Sai Sandeep from IIT Bombay.

2:38 PM Team rake_compress consisting of tourist and qwerty787788 from ITMO is currently struggling in the problem SHUFFLE2.

2:36 PM Youngest team consisting of a single team member Mriganka has solved one problem.

2:30 PM Team believe_iiith from IITH consisting of pulkitg10 and viv001 currently at third position in onsite contest

2:28 PM In online mirror, jenabkhan is leading with solving two problems. Participation is slightly less in the mirror round. Hope to see more participation in upcoming time.

2:26PM
Total 21 teams have solved at least problem in onsite contest. There are 4 more teams to solve at least one problem.

2:15 PM: Team smack_down ranked 2 in onsite contest.

Smit Hinsu and Siddharth Bora from Tower Research Captial

2:13 PM: Team ancalagon leading the onsite ranking.

Balajiganapathi and Deepa Panwar from IIT Bombay

2:11 PM: aapppppppiii and rake_compress are having a pretty close competition with each other. rake_compress is just having 1 extra penalty points. There are two problems which are solved by only one of the teams. So, we hope to see ranking changes in next few hours or so.

2:08 PM: Currently total 6 problems have been solved. There are still 5 problems to be solved.

2:04 PM: Currently the ranking has not changed much. Team from google, logicmonks_ has come to third place replacing believe_iiith which has been an ICPC world finals team from India. Team logicmonks_ consists of Akashdeep Nain and Nishant Redkar.

2:00 PM: The finals mirror contest has been started. Let us see how it unfolds :)

1:58 PM, Team ancalagon is leading the onsite contest from the beginning of the contest. Total 14 teams has solved at least some problem in first hour. So, there are still 11 teams remaining to solve anything.

We will post images of participants here in few minutes :)

1:55 PM Please note that the finals mirror will start in 5 minutes. You have some information about number of solved problems with you already :) Bring it on !! Happy programming to all.

1:47 PM: Team aapppppppiii from Tsinghua is currently leading the scoreboard. rake_compress is currently ranked 2. It would be interesting to see what folds in few upcoming hours.

1:44 PM: Current online finals rankings

  1. rake_compress consisting of tourist and qwerty787788 from ITMO (Saint Petersburg National Research University of Information Technologies, Mechanics and Optics).

  2. two_captains from Yandex consisting of Mikhail Tikhomirov (Endagorion) and Alexander Mashrabov (map)

  3. sequoia consisting of Alexander Ostanin (Kostroma) and Alexey Dmitriev (AlexDmitriev) from Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology

  4. dreamoon_shik consisting of dreamoon from National Taiwan University.

1:40 PM: Currently total 4 problems have been solved by at least one team ANDMAT, WMIS, TENNIS, NICENESS.

1:39 PM: Team sandy_team is now on top of onsite contest. The team consists of Sai Sandeep from IIT Bombay.

1:37 PM: team ancalagon is on fire. It has solved 2 problems to currently lead the onsite finals.

1:30 PM: It's been half an hour after the contest has started.
Currently, team rake_compress consisting of tourist and qwerty787788 is leading with solving three problems.
From the onsite contest, team ancalagon consisting of Balajiganapathi and Deepa Panwar from IIT Bombay is leading with solving one problem.
